intro: Thibaudia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
